intro: Ipomoea subspicata var. induta, commonly known as the velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant is a climbing vine with tendrils that allow it to攀援 on supports. Its flowers typically bloom in the morning, giving it its common name. The species is known for its rapid growth and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
